definition: vivid and lifelike (idiom); true to life/realistic

sentences.english: Head and nose and shoulders back legs, vivid, each are outlined in a vividly.
sentences.chinese: 頭鼻肩腰腳，栩栩如生，每一筆都勾畫的惟妙惟肖。

sentences.english: Some people are able to make the puppets appear alive.
sentences.chinese: 有些人能將戲偶舞得栩栩如生。
這匹馬看起來栩栩如生。

sentences.english: The galloping horses he paints are extremely lifelike .
sentences.chinese: 他畫的奔馬，栩栩如生，極其神似。

sentences.english: Imagination is sometimes more vivid than reality.
sentences.chinese: 想象之於現實或更栩栩然。

sentences.english: Cheerful expression goatherd lifelike, seem to be specially to welcome us.
sentences.chinese: 牧童歡快的表情栩栩如生，好象是特意來歡迎我們的。

sentences.english: He painted the horse to the life.
sentences.chinese: 他把那匹馬畫得栩栩如生。

sentences.english: Do you have vivid dreams or hallucinations as you fall asleep or wake up?
sentences.chinese: 當你醒來或睡覺時有過栩栩如生的夢境或幻覺嗎？

sentences.english: There are a lot of vivid professional match-makers in Baihua novels in late Ming dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 晚明白話小說中塑造了大量栩栩如生的職業媒妁形象。

sentences.english: A good actor renders a character to the life.
sentences.chinese: 好演員能將一個人物演得栩栩如生。

sentences.english: On top of the bridge are4 lifelike stone lions.
sentences.chinese: 橋欄上還雕有四隻栩栩如生的石獅。

sentences.english: View within the ice also lifelike, vivid.
sentences.chinese: 冰塊內的觀賞也同樣栩栩如生，活靈活現。

sentences.english: He can draw a lively cat in five minutes.
sentences.chinese: 他能在五分鐘內畫出一隻栩栩如生的貓。

sentences.english: Some of the colors in the grottos are still original and vivid.
sentences.chinese: 窟內的一些顏色仍舊保持原樣，栩栩如生。

sentences.english: How to make a lively grasshopper with leaves.
sentences.chinese: 如何利用樹葉編織製作栩栩如生的草蜢。

sentences.english: The writer made this historical character live in his book.
sentences.chinese: 作家在書中將這一歷史人物描寫得栩栩如生。

definition: vivid and lifelike (idiom); true to life/realistic
to imitate to perfection/to be remarkably true to life
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
to dazzle/to brighten up (a room etc)
clear and bright/with a big smile
(of calligraphy) full of power and grace
lit. fine sculpting (idiom); fig. to work with extreme care and precision
to resemble closely/to be the very image of/to look very much like/to be the spitting image of
